intro: Tribulus alacranensis, commonly known as the scorpion bean, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Zygophyllaceae and is characterized by its spiny, thorned stems and leaves. The plant produces yellowish flowers that are followed by elongated, pod-like fruits containing small, hard seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
